page.title: 03HORTON-CUM-STUDLEY 1985
page.content: Horton-cum-Studley is a straggling village seven miles E.N.E. of Oxford and three miles from Beckley. The houses are mainly modern and built in groups set back from the through road. Some of these groups have won design awards. There are some older buildings such as the Victorian Church, Studley Priory Hotel, the Almshouses built in 1636 and several stone farms and thatched cottages. There is a Post Office/ Village Stores which sells petrol, a public house called the King's Arms and a small village hall.
